bow: had bad scare today still shaking was visiting friends with my 6mo old today after changing her diaper upstairs went to go down the stairs holding the railing in one hand baby in the other you friends were great took us to the er baby was fine did even get bump on her head just little redness she took nap while was waiting for rays doc says shes fine just bruised my tail bone know accidents with little ones are par for the course but usually they are their own bumps and bruises not caused by mommy clumsiness anyone else out there that can share moment of being new parent and having situation like this guess just looking for some validation that not complete fuck up as new mom thanks for letting me rant next day edit thanks everyone for sharing your stories after decent nights sleep and lots of hugs for my baby girl today feel like part of an exclusive group now instead of fuck up there is no shame in that you were doing anything risky or stupid if it makes you feel better this was top post my children have had their fair share of tumbles falls and bumps and am sad to say many of them have been directly or indirectly due to my immense clumsiness none of them have ever so much as broken bone or needed stitch it happens to lot of us please do hold it against yourself at least you did leave baby in the carseat unbuckled in the back seat of the car only to notice when you took corner nope honey that was me edit missed word me too nope skulled every one of my three kids thinking had door frame clearance had an extremely similar accident with my son when he was 10 months old it was new year eve and was heading to family party as single mom in university did get out much so dressed up all nice right down to pair of heels lived in rented room on the second floor of home built in the 1920s steep narrow stair case and no railing was holding my son on my right hip while locked my door left handed so he was towards the stairs was in rush to catch bus and my ankle twisted as turned and just knew we were going down somehow managed to twist almost full 180 degrees as fell my son basically rode my hip the whole way down was bruised all to heck on my left side for
